Creating an LDAP Provider

 1. In the Domain Configuration screen, ensure that the Realm selection is Ldap, and then select Provider Group from the list. click ‘+’ LDAP Providers screen is displayed.

 2. In the LDAP Providers screen, click the ‘+’ icon. Add/Edit LDAP Provider page is displayed.

 3. In the Add/Edit LDAP Provider page, enter the required fields according to your provider.

Figure 3-6 LDAP Provider

Table 3-1 LDAP Parameters

Field Name

Description

Hostname

The hostname/IP address on which the LDAP provider resides.

Order

The provider sequential order to authenticate users in Cisco UCS ADA domain. The sequential order for the provider can be defined up to 16.

Ensure there are no duplicate orders created.

Bind DN

The distinguished name (DN) for an LDAP database account that has read and search permissions for all objects under the base DN.

The maximum supported string length is 127 ASCII characters.

Base DN

The user's DN based on their username. The maximum supported string length is 127 characters.

Port

The port through which Cisco UCS communicates with the LDAP database. The default port number is 389.

Enable SSL

The selection indicates that the encryption is required to communicate with the LDAP database.

Filter

The LDAP filer search is provided to restrict usernames that match the defined filter

Attribute

This is an LDAP attribute values for the user roles and locales.

Password

The password for the LDAP database account specified in the Bind DN field

Confirm Password

The confirmation password that is required to authenticate the LDAP database.

Timeout

The length of time in seconds the system should spend trying to contact the LDAP database before it times out.

Enter an integer from 1 to 60 seconds. The default is 30 seconds.

Vendor

The vendor for the LDAP service providers

Authorization

The authorization for the LDAP provides

Recursion

To make the LDAP recursive or non- recursive

Target Attribute

LDAP target attribute

Primary Group

If this is a primary group

 4. Click Save to create an LDAP provider.

Similarly, repeat step 2 and 3 to create as many LDAP provider(s) you need.

 5. In the LDAP Providers page, select the required provider(s) you wish to include in the group.

 6. Click the > button to add the providers in the LDAP Providers Groups.

You can use X to remove providers from the group.

 7. After you have added all desired providers to the provider group, click Save & Return.
